info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 9:47PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lincoln, western Mecklenburg and eastern Gaston Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 947 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Uptown Charlotte, or near Northwest Charlotte, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Huntersville, Gastonia, Central Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Mt Holly, Belmont and Cramerton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
